thread.title: How tech companies celebrated (on Twitter) International Women's Day
thread.title_full: How tech companies celebrated (on Twitter) International Women's Day

author: Kerry Flynn
title: How tech companies celebrated (on Twitter) International Women's Day
text:
Among the more than 7.5 million tweets related to International Women's Day, tech companies showed up, too, and released their statements of solidarity and appreciation for the gender that they, for the most part, fail to equally represent and support in their industry.
SEE ALSO: Google Doodle celebrates 13 badass women for International Women's Day
Without further ado, let us share with you their appreciation:
Apple Women‚Äôs rights are human rights. Today we celebrate, we speak up and we listen. #InternationalWomensDay pic.twitter.com/YqQlRoAkyO
‚Äî Tim Cook (@tim_cook) March 8, 2017
Google We're proud to honor amazing women pioneers and committed to supporting women everywhere #InternationalWomensDay https://t.co/klnnb30pzx
‚Äî sundarpichai (@sundarpichai) March 8, 2017
Google CEO Sundar Pichai and Google execs also wore red ribbons at Google Cloud Next conference Wednesday.
YouTube It‚Äôs #InternationalWomensDay so give it up for the women around the world who inspire us all. https://t.co/Us07W4e224 #HerVoiceIsMyVoice pic.twitter.com/Q16VwRBPul
‚Äî YouTube (@YouTube) March 8, 2017
Microsoft Change the world, stay in STEM. #MakeWhatsNext #IWD2017 https://t.co/lahzoL2hWs pic.twitter.com/cqrzxAjU0D
‚Äî Microsoft (@Microsoft) March 7, 2017
"Enduring lessons from my mother" https://t.co/g2BP04Oo74 #IWD2017
‚Äî Satya Nadella (@satyanadella) March 7, 2017
Facebook
Nothing from CEO Mark Zuckerberg on his Facebook page, but here's another one from COO Sheryl Sandberg.
Instagram By all standards, Blair Cherelstein (@blurchur) leads the life of your average 22-year-old. ‚ÄúI wake up, I go to class, my job, my internship,‚Äù says Blair, a film major in West Virginia. ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs this misperception that trans people operate under a different way of life, but I don‚Äôt do anything that a cis person [someone who identifies with their birth sex] would do differently in their day.‚Äù Having known since the age of 4 that she was a girl who happened to be born with the body of a boy ‚Äî ‚ÄúHealth class was confusing as hell‚Äù ‚Äî Blair started taking hormones more than four years ago to transition into the woman she is today. ‚ÄúTo me, femininity means power,‚Äù says Blair. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm so proud of the sense of community I feel with other women.‚Äù In honor of International #WomensDay, Blair is going to keep it simple: ‚ÄúI just celebrate it by being in public and holding my girlfriend‚Äôs hand.‚Äù This post is in celebration of Women‚Äôs History Month. Throughout March, we‚Äôll be highlighting the stories of women doing extraordinary things around the world.
A post shared by Instagram (@instagram) on Mar 8, 2017 at 8:57am PST

Musical.ly Happy #InternationalWomensDay ! Celebrate #girlpower with us today on musical.ly! üí™‚ú® @indicowie 's soccer skills are EVERYTHING üòç‚öΩÔ∏è pic.twitter.com/JqxsOAmUge

Squarespace Celebrate #InternationalWomensDay with remarkable, diverse women who share a passion for literature. @girlsatlibrary https://t.co/94jeJznkhf pic.twitter.com/zHoLR6Svl6
‚Äî Squarespace (@squarespace) March 8, 2017
Blue Apron Today, we celebrate all women & recognize the invaluable work women farmers do globally. https://t.co/Z28fnD10qd #InternationalWomensDay pic.twitter.com/Le7LXZXxUS
‚Äî Blue Apron (@blueapron) March 8, 2017
Snap Snapchat has Frida Kahlo, Rosa Parks, and Marie Curie filters for #InternationalWomensDay üòç
‚Äî Shannon Doleski (@ShannonDoleski) March 8, 2017
Snap Inc. may have gotten some heat for its fun filters, but the company at large is taking Women's History Month and International Women's Day seriously. The company and its women's diversity resource group is hosting educational events celebration, such as workshops and lunches, every week in March.
Karissa Bell and Freia Lobo contributed reporting.
